Text: color? YUCK, wayy better in its good ole format...thanks anyways

Thanks very much, media2007, for this terrific upload! It's great to be able to watch wonderful old classics in color, just for variety's sake.

No harm is being done when classics are colorized. The original B&W's are still available - as great as ever - and the viewing option is nice to have.

BTW, if anyone has the colorized version of "The Bishop's Wife" with Cary Grant, please post it. Thanks.
best movie ever made cant wait to see it in colour  thanx media2007 , and a merry christmas
excellent picture quality (even though it is colourised!) but no audio! Any ideas?
No audio? Sound is in original AC3. You need AC3 codec. Use VLC player or install AC3 filter http://ac3filter.net/
this was a rubiss movee befor, but now it in color its wickid
